intro: Anetium citrifolium, commonly known as the citron leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic properties. Anetium citrifolium thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments.
